paragraphs.text: Town told to keep Christ out of Christmas parade.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: The annual Christmas parade in Piedmont, Alabama is a big deal in this small town tucked away in the foothills of the Appalachian Mountains
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The Piedmont parade doesn't have giant helium-filled balloons or dancing Broadway show girls
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they do have the local high school marching band and Santa Claus parades down North Main Street on a bright red fire truck
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: And just about every girl who's ever won a beauty pageant will be riding on a float
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "We've got beautiful girls in Alabama," Mayor Bill Baker told me
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: This year's grand marshal is the Piedmont High School track team - state champions - the pride of the town
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "We try to honor our kids and we try to give recognition to those who do well," Mayor Baker said
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "We're proud to have them leading the parade."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: But the town also wanted to honor the "reason for the season"
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that landed them in a world of trouble with a group of out-of-town atheists
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: CLICK HERE TO FOLLOW TODD ON FACEBOOK FOR CONSERVATIVE CONVERSATION!
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: The parade committee selected "Keep Christ in Christmas" as the theme of Thursday night's parade
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Seeing how there' s a church on nearly every street corner in town
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: no one gave it a second thought
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "It was a great theme," the mayor said
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "I was totally shocked when I received the letter
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: It's a small town
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: It's a small Christmas parade
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: We didn't think there would be any problems at all."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Little did the mayor know that his town was about to be infested with an ill- tempered gaggle of atheists from Wisconsin - the Freedom From Religion Foundation (FFRF)
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They alleged that a single person in Piedmont had complained about the parade theme
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: - and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the FFRF sent the mayor a threatening letter
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The theme "alienates non-Christians and others in Piedmont who do not in fact have a 'strong belief in prayers' by turning them into political outsiders in their own community," FFRF attorney Andrew Seidel wrote
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "The sentiment of 'Keeping Christ in Christmas' does not qualify as a secular celebration."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: They told the city to find a "more appropriate, more inclusive, and constitutional theme" for the parade
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: It's not the first time that the perpetually offended atheists have targeted Piedmont
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Earlier this year, they demanded that the local high school stop reciting prayers before football games
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "Somebody filed a complaint and we had to stop that," the mayor said
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Well
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: to be accurate- they sort of stopped praying
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: from that point on folks would gather on the football field before the game
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "And as citizens, we recited the Lord's Prayer - out loud," Mayor Baker said
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "One week we had the entire football field encircled by people
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: It was really wonderful and very moving to me to see people come together and praise God and speak His name out loud."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The prayer controversy was one of the reasons why the parade committee wanted to make a statement during the Christmas parade
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Unfortunately, the city attorney told the mayor that the theme violated the law
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: there was nothing they could do
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But the folks around Piedmont are not the kind of folks who back away from a fight
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They're a pretty resourceful bunch
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: While they agreed to not officially have a parade theme
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: - the city has decided to keep Christ in Christmas in other ways
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "Nothing has really changed," the mayor told me
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "We still have the same religious floats
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: We still have the churches
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: We still have the beauty queens
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: We're still going to have this wonderful Christian parade regardless of if we have a theme or not."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: And they also found a way to legally keep Christ in the parade
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They mayor said local citizens will be marching with signs reading"Let's Keep Christ in Christmas."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "They paid their entry fees," the mayor said
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "It's a positive march
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: it's not a protest march
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: They are keeping the theme alive even though legally we had to do away with it."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The mayor is a kind-hearted fellow
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but he's not one to be trifled with
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: - and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he's none too pleased with the out-of-town atheists
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "It annoys me that a small group of people can do what they do and get away with it and the majority has to suffer," the mayor said
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "They are infringing on my beliefs."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: And he also had some words of advice for the one person in town who complained
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "I'd like to tell that one person - whoever he or she is - if they even exist- to stay at home," he said
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "If they don't like a Christian theme, if they don't like a Christian parade- stay at home."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Ironically, all the recent controversy has been a good thing - a blessing in disguise, the mayor said
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "The town has rallied," he told me
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: "I appreciate all the citizens who got on Facebook and the telephone and talked to each other
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: It's heartwarming to me to see the Christian response that has developed."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: So if you happen to be in North Alabama tonight, be sure to drop by the parade
paragraphs.label: other

paragraphs.text: Miss Piedmont will be there - along with Miss Calendar
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The local Boy Scout troop will be hoisting Old Glory
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: you might even get a candy cane from Old Saint Nick - provided there'
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: s not a last minute fire
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Merry Christmas, Piedmont
paragraphs.label: other
